name: Clandulla Cottages, Beaudesert

reviews.text: Well, that is what our 7 year old who had never really left the City said when we told him we were going to stay on a farm for 3 days. On the day we got there he first fell in love with the Dogs, then the Cows, the Sheep and everything else. By the second day, he was upset because we went to the theme park and could not get back by 5:30 PM for the animals evening feed.
reviews.title: "I dont want to stay on a Farm. . . ."

reviews.text: By day 3 we were chatting by the tree in the evening and our little guy was playing with Gilly the Kangaroo. Gilly does not welcome attention and withdraws into her quiet den and when she lets people play with her, it is something special to watch.
reviews.title: A memorable introduction to the farm life

reviews.text: It was great to see our 3 Kids go looking for the animals everytime they were bored and not turn on the TV or the Computer. It was wonderful to see the bonds the developed with the animals.
reviews.title: We were welcomed as a part of the family, a home away from home

reviews.text: For the grown ups it was a special time sharing the lives of John and Lorna and how they have turned an old, uncared for farm used only to raise racehorses into a little haven where people can go to really chill out, turn off the cares of the world and totally relax.
reviews.title: Perfect Family Break
Amazing, fabulous, terrific, can't recommend enough!!
reviews.text: We were welcomed by the hosts John and Lorna, such lovely people who we spent much of our stay chatting to. The rooms are comfortable and the fresh eggs and bacon delicious. Peace and quiet and very relaxing, no need to leave the farm all day, you can just happily laze about. The kids will love the animals and the trampoline/swings. The animal feedings are informative and enjoyable to watch. John and Lorna are very accomodating and will happily go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. I recommend Clandulla as a wonderful place to go as a couple or as a family. Thumbs up! We'll be back.

We visited with 3 children under 10 years and had a lovely time. We stayed in the Mexicana Suite which was perfect for us. The beds were very comfy! Despite rain & drizzle , the kids still had a great time. We took raincoats so they could still play outdoors in the rain. The TV had Austar which helped keep us all happy during wetter periods! The kids were a little timid at first but soon became more confident and comfortable with all the animals. The dogs, chickens, frogs,peacocks and kangaroos were a big hit! Canungra and Beaudesert are close by if you need supplies and the location to Tamborine is perfect. We were very comfy and overall had a great time. Great spot for weddings or family gatherings. Lorna and John are perfect hosts and made us feel very welcome. We will be back!
reviews.title: a lovely time...

reviews.text: We stayed in the Mexicano which was well appointed. We all enjoyed the friendly animals, play area and enclosed grounds for safe wandering. Clandulla was kid friendly but still attained a peaceful atmosphere for the adults. It is within day trip distance of many local attractions. We will be back.
reviews.title: Genuine, friendly farmstay

reviews.title: Wedding Party

reviews.text: The Bridal Party booked all the Cottages that were available at Clandulla Cottages from the 11th to 12th of March.
reviews.title: Special place - special owners

reviews.text: The site, facilities and hospitality of the owners were excellent !
reviews.title: excellent farmstay and hospitality

reviews.text: We just spent 2 nights in the Mexicana suite, 2 adults, young child and baby. Our little boy had a wonderful time with the animals and eating fruit straight from the tree. Hosts John and Lorna are exceptionally welcoming, kind people who greet you like long lost friends and do everything they can to make your stay wonderful. I highly recommend Clandulla to families with children, they will have the time of their lives :-)
reviews.title: Great getaway for the kids

reviews.text: not do enough for us. I felt like I was staying with old friends and it felt that way the minute we arrived. Can't wait to return to see how big Barney the lamb has grown. Do yourself a favor and take the kids away for a weekend you won't regret it.
reviews.title: People Nice, Accommodation OK, our Stay horrible

reviews.text: We (my husband and 2 kids aged 6 yrs old and 2 yrs old) stayed at Clandulla Cottages from 20-22 May 2011. We stayed in the Mexicano suite which was very spacious and clean. Hosts, John and Lorna, were also very hospitable and my kids thoroughly enjoyed their stay there with "Uncle John" and "Auntie Lorna". The farm was spacious and very safe for my 2 active kids to run around in without supervision. They thoroughly enjoyed playing with the 2 dogs, Max and Jack, and the 2 kangeroos who were roaming around the estate. Animal feeding time was also what they looked forward to during our short 2 days stay there.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Unwind after a Long Journey..

reviews.text: We wanted a quiet relaxing place and we found it. Very comfortable and spacious accommodation. Excellent views. Exceptional hospitality and service. Everything we needed. We will certainly be going back.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: This was our second visit to Clandulla. The previous was in August 2009. We had raved so much about Clandulla, two other families came with us. So we share the Main Building (Mexicano, Camelot and Ototoks) between us all. And it was fabulous. The children were in their element and didn't get a chance to play with about 85% of the things we'd brought to occupy them. John had them helping out with the animals and we adults lazed under in the swing chairs under the "Talking Tree" and talked and drank.
reviews.title: Second trip to Clandulla and enjoyed it more than the first time!

reviews.text: Lorna's Saturday night feast was absolutely magnificent. And to have it served on our deck so we could be near the sleeping children was fantastic.
reviews.title: Learn how to really relax and remember what real food tastes like!!
Perfect in every way
reviews.text: I give every part of Clandulla and its gracious hosts top marks. Thank you Lorna & John and see you in 2011.
M x
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend. Felt so welcomed. Will definitely come back again.

description: Clandulla Cottages and Farmstay is a tranquil and private getaway featuring luxurious self contained accommodation. Located in the Gold Coast Hinterland at the foot of Tamborine Mountain, Clandulla Cottages are just a 1 hour drive from Brisbane and an easy 40 minute drive from the Gold Coast.Clandulla Cottages are nestled in some of the Scenic Rim Regions most beautiful countryside and on the doorstep of award-winning wineries and the best equine stables and polo fields.Whether you're looking for adventure or just some peace and relaxation, Clandulla Cottages has something for everyone.We even offer facilities for you to bring your own horse, perfect for those who are attending one of the many equine events in the area.
